      • computeResult

        public java.lang.Object[] computeResult()
        Description copied from interface: ReactionRule
        This method describes the reaction process. If reagents are needed, attributes can be created in the ReactionRule implementation and used there.
        Any kind of operations with (or without) reagents can be done in this method. However, it must returns a Java Object array containing the results of the reaction. For example, if a reaction processes a choice between two reagents in order to keep only one, this one should be returned in an Object array at the end. A reaction that simply consumes its reagents should return an empty Object array.
        At the end of the reaction process during the execution, every reagent is consumed and then disappear from the solution, unless it is returned in the result array. Refer to usecases for examples.
        Specified by:
        computeResult in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        an Object array containing what should be reinjected in the solution at the end of the reaction.

      • computeSelect

        public boolean computeSelect()
        Description copied from interface: ReactionRule
        This method describes conditions of reagents selection. During execution, the attributes of the ReactionRule are instanciated with matching-type reagents from the solution. This method is then called to check if the instanciated reagents respect particular conditions.
        This method should therefore contains every needed verification on the reagents. For example if the reaction should only react with integers higher than 0, it must be checked there.
        In case no selection is necessary, the annotation @Dontuse can be used before declaration. It is then equivalent to simply returning true, but treated differently in order to speed up the execution. Refer to usecases for examples.
        Specified by:
        computeSelect in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        true if the present reagents are compatible with the reaction.

      • getMultiplicity

        public ReactionRule.Multiplicity getMultiplicity()
        Description copied from interface: ReactionRule
        This method must return the multiplicity of the reaction. Two of them exist:

        ONE_SHOT indicates that the reaction will happen only once, the ReactionRule will then be removed from the solution.

        INFINITY_SHOT indicates that the reaction will always happen if reagents are present, until solution inertia. Contrary to OneShot, the ReactionRule will not be removed from the solution after reaction.

        Specified by:
        getMultiplicity in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        the multiplicity of the reaction (ONE_SHOT or INFINITY_SHOT).
